description.last: Uses the last-used mode, active if none
description.passive: Parity syncs initially, then sleeps and wakes regularly to resync
description.dark: Parity syncs only when the RPC is active

mode_timeout.name: Mode Timeout
mode_timeout.description: Parity will move to inactive mode after {} seconds.

mode_alarm.name: Mode Alarm
mode_alarm.description: Parity will automatically wake-up every {} seconds.

description.current: Whatever track this executable was released on

public_node.name: Public node
public_node.description: Start Parity as a public web server. Account storage and transaction signing will be delegated to the UI.

no_download.name: Don't Download Updates
no_download.description: Disables auto downloading of new releases. Not recommended.

no_consensus.name: No Consensus
no_consensus.description: Forces Parity to run even if there are known issues regarding consensus. Not recommended.

base_path.name: Base Path
base_path.description: Blockchain and settings will be stored in {}.

db_path.name: Database Path
db_path.description: Parity databases will be stored in {}.

keys_path.name: Keys Path
keys_path.description: Your encrypted private keys will be stored in {}.

identity.name: Identity
identity.description: You will be identified as '{}' amongst other nodes..

light.name: Light
light.description: Experimental: run in light client mode. Light clients synchronize a bare minimum of data and fetch necessary data on-demand from the network. Much lower in storage, potentially higher in bandwidth. Has no effect with subcommands.

no_persistent_txqueue.name: No persistent txqueue
no_persistent_txqueue.description: Don't save pending local transactions to disk to be restored whenever the node restarts.

unlock.name: Accounts to unlock
unlock.description: From: [{}] you'll be able to send tranasactions without password.

password.name: Password File
password.description: File at {} should contain passwords to unlock your accounts. One password per line.

keys_iterations.name: Keys deriving iterations
keys_iterations.description: Parity will do {} iterations to derive private keys from passphrase (higher=safer).

refresh_time.name: Refresh time
refresh_time.description: Specify the cache time of accounts read from disk. If you manage thousands of accounts set this to 0 to disable refresh.

fast_unlock.name: Fast unlock
fast_unlock.description: Use drasticly faster unlocking mode. This setting causes raw secrets to be stored unprotected in memory, so use with care.

account.description: Unlocking accounts and private keys security parameters.

force.name: Force Enable Wallet
force.description: Enable Signer even when it would be disabled by other options.

disable.name: Disable Wallet
disable.description: You will need to unlock accounts manually if Wallet is disabled.

port.name: Port
port.description: Wallet will be accessible on port {}.

interface.name: Interface
interface.description: Wallet will listen for connections on IP {}.

hosts.name: Hosts
hosts.description: List of allowed Host header values. This option will validate the Host header sent by the browser, it is additional security against some attack vectors. Special options: "all", "none",.

path.name: Path
path.description: Wallet configuration will be stored at {}.

ui.description: UI is used to manage your wallet, confirm and sign transactions.

warp.name: Warp Sync
warp.description: Parity will sync by downloading latest state first. Node will be operational in couple minutes.

port.name: Port
port.description: Parity will listen for connections on port {}.

min_peers.name: Min Peers
min_peers.description: Parity will try to maintain connection to at least {} peers.

max_peers.name: Max Peers
max_peers.description: Parity will maintain at most {} peers.

snapshot_peers.name: Snapshot Sync Peers
snapshot_peers.description: Parity will maintain additional {} peers for snapshot sync.

max_pending_peers.name: Max Pending Peers
max_pending_peers.description: Parity will allow up to {} pending connections.

description.any: Parity will use all possible methods to determine public IP address.
description.none: Parity won't attempt detect you public IP address
description.upnp: Parity will use UPNP to detect your public IP address.
description.extip:: Fill up the config manually and provide your public IP address.

description.all: Parity will not filter outbound connections.
description.private: Parity will connect only to private network IP addresses.
description.public: Parity will connect only to public network IP addresses.

id.name: Network ID
id.description: Network ID of the chain will be overridden to: {}

bootnodes.name: Bootnodes
bootnodes.description: Override the bootnodes from selected chain file.

discovery.name: Peers Discovery
discovery.description: Enable or disable new peers discovery.

node_key.name: Node Key
node_key.description: Specify node secret key (64-char hex or input to SHA3)

reserved_peers.name: Reserved Peers Path
reserved_peers.description: Specify a path to a file with peers' enodes to be always connected to.

network.description: Network and peer-related settings. Network is not available if Parity is in offline mode.

disable.name: Disable JSON-RPC
disable.description: You won't be able to interact with Parity using JSON-RPC over HTTP.

port.name: Port
port.description: JSON-RPC over HTTP will be accessible on port {}.

interface.name: Interface
interface.description: JSON-RPC will be listening for connections on IP {}.

apis.name: Exposed APIs
apis.description: Only selected APIs will be exposed over this interface.

hosts.name: Allowed Hosts
hosts.description: Allow connections only using specified addresses.

server_threads.name: Server threads
server_threads.description: Threads for handling incoming connections for HTTP JSON-RPC server.

processing_threads.name: Processing threads
processing_threads.description: Turn on additional processing threads in all RPC servers. Setting this to non-zero value allows parallel cpu-heavy queries execution.

disable.name: Disable WebSockets
disable.description: UI won't work and WebSockets server will be not available.

port.name: Port
port.description: JSON-RPC over WebSockets will be accessible on port {}.

interface.name: Interface
interface.description: JSON-RPC will be listening for connections on IP {}.

apis.name: Exposed APIs
apis.description: Only selected APIs will be exposed over this interface.

hosts.name: Allowed Hosts
hosts.description: Allow connections only using specified addresses.

disable.name: Disable IPC
disable.description: You won't be able to use IPC to interact with Parity.

path.name: Path
path.description: Parity will create an IPC socket at {}.

apis.name: Exposed APIs
apis.description: Only selected APIs will be exposed over this interface.

disable.name: Disable
disable.description: Disable the Dapps server (e.g. status page).

port.name: Port
port.description: Dapps server is merged with RPC server. Use --jsonrpc-port.

interface.name: Interface
interface.description: Dapps server is merged with RPC server. Use --jsonrpc-interface.

hosts.name: Hosts
hosts.description: Dapps server is merged with RPC server. Use --jsonrpc-hosts.

cors.name: Cors
cors.description: Dapps server is merged with RPC server. Use --jsonrpc-cors.

path.name: Path
path.description: Specify directory where dapps should be installed.

user.name: User
user.description: Dapps server authentication has been removed.

pass.name: Pass
pass.description: Dapps server authentication has been removed.

dapps.description: Run and customize the web Dapps Server.

disable.name: Disable Secret Store
disable.description: You won't be able to encrypt and decrypt secrets.

disable_acl_check.name: Disable acl check
disable_acl_check.description: Disable ACL check (useful for test environments).

disable_auto_migrate.name: Disable auto migrate
disable_auto_migrate.description: Do not run servers set change session automatically when servers set changes. This option has no effect when servers set is read from configuration file.

service_contract.name: Service contract
service_contract.description: Secret Store Service contract address source: none, registry (contract address is read from registry) or address.

self_secret.name: Self secret
self_secret.description: Hex-encoded secret key of this node.

admin_public.name: Admin public
admin_public.description: Hex-encoded public key of secret store administrator.

nodes.name: Nodes
nodes.description: List of other secret store cluster nodes. Format: NODE_PUBLIC_KEY_IN_HEX@NODE_IP:NODE_PORT

interface.name: Interface
interface.description: Secret Store will listen for connections on IP {}.

port.name: Port
port.description: Secret Store will be running on port {}.

http_interface.name: HTTP Interface
http_interface.description: Secret Store will listen for HTTP requests on IP {}.

http_port.name: HTTP Port
http_port.description: Secret Store HTTP iface will be running on port {}.

path.name: Path
path.description: Encrypted secrets will be stored in {}.

secretstore.description: Secret Store. Requires a special build of Parity.

port.name: Port
port.description: Secret Store will be running on port {}.

interface.name: Interface
interface.description: Secret Store will listen for connections on IP {}.

hosts.name: Allowed Hosts
hosts.description: Allow connections only using specified addresses.

author.name: Author (Coinbase)
author.description: Account address to receive reward when block is mined.

engine_signer.name: Engine Signer
engine_signer.description: Account to sign consensus messages and issue blocks for non-PoW chains.

force_sealing.name: Force Sealing
force_sealing.description: Prepare a block to seal even when there are no miners connected.

reseal_on_uncle.name: Reseal on uncle
reseal_on_uncle.description: Force the node to author new blocks when a new uncle block is imported.

description.none: New transactions will not cause a new pending block to be created.
description.own: New pending block will be created only on transactions sent using local RPC/IPC
description.ext: New pending block will be created only on external transactions.
description.all: New pending block will be created for all transactions (both local and external).

reseal_min_period.name: Reseal Period
reseal_min_period.description: New pending block will be created only once per {} milliseconds.

reseal_max_period.name: Reseal max period
reseal_max_period.description: Specify the maximum time since last block to enable force-sealing. MS is time measured in milliseconds.

work_queue_size.name: Work Queue Size
work_queue_size.description: Parity will produce at most {} distinct pending blocks for miners.

tx_gas_limit.name: Gas Limit per Transaction
tx_gas_limit.description: Parity will reject transactions above {} gas.

tx_time_limit.name: Time Limit per Transaction [ms]
tx_time_limit.description: Parity will start banning senders/code when execution exceeds specified limit.

description.cheap: Relay any transaction in the queue (may include invalid transactions).
description.strict: Relay only executed transactions (will relay nothing if not mining).
description.lenient: Same as strict when mining, and cheap when not.

min_gas_price.name: Min gas price
min_gas_price.description: Minimum amount of Wei per GAS to be paid for a transaction to be accepted for mining. Overrides --usd-per-tx.

gas_price_percentile.name: Gas price percentile
gas_price_percentile.description: Set PCT percentile gas price value from last 100 blocks as default gas price when sending transactions.

usd_per_tx.name: USD per Transaction
usd_per_tx.description: You will be paid ${} for a basic transaction - Minimum gas price will be set accordingly.

usd_per_eth.name: USD per Eth
usd_per_eth.description: Specify source (URL) or current price of Eth.

price_update_period.name: Price Update Period
price_update_period.description: Parity will update price per ETH every {}.

gas_floor_target.name: Gas Floor Target
gas_floor_target.description: Targeting {} gas per block when sealing a new block.

gas_cap.name: Gas Cap
gas_cap.description: Gas limit will be raised at most by {} gas.

extra_data.name: Extra Data
extra_data.description: Blocks that you mine will have '{}' in extra data field.

tx_queue_size.name: Transaction Queue Size
tx_queue_size.description: Parity will keep/relay at most {} transactions in queue.

tx_queue_mem_limit.name: Tx queue mem limit
tx_queue_mem_limit.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be used by the transaction queue. Setting this parameter to 0 disables limiting.

tx_queue_gas.name: Tx queue gas
tx_queue_gas.description: Maximum amount of total gas for external transactions in the queue. LIMIT can be either an amount of gas or 'auto' or 'off'. 'auto' sets the limit to be 20x the current block gas limit.

description.gas_price: Txs in the queue are ordered by gas price (high gas price = high priority)
description.gas: Txs in the queue are ordered by gas (low gas = high priority)
description.gas_factory: Txs in the queue are ordered by gas/2^15 + gas_price (low gas or high gas+high fee = high priority)

tx_queue_ban_count.name: Ban After
tx_queue_ban_count.description: Parity will start banning senders/code when execution exceeds limit {} time(s).

tx_queue_ban_time.name: Ban For
tx_queue_ban_time.description: Parity will ban senders/code for {} seconds.

remove_solved.name: Remove Solved Blocks
remove_solved.description: Removes solved blocks - faster import speed, but extra solutions to the same work package will go unused.

notify_work.name: Notify Work
notify_work.description: URLs to which work package notifications are pushed.

infinite_pending_block.name: Infinite pending block
infinite_pending_block.description: Pending block will be created with maximal possible gas limit and will execute all transactions in the queue. Note that such block is invalid and should never be attempted to be mined.

description.on: Compute and Store tracing data. (Enables trace_* APIs).
description.auto: Disable tracing unless it was enable previously for that DB.

description.fast: Prune old state data. Maintains journal overlay - fast but extra 50MB of memory used.
description.archive: Keep all state trie data. No pruning.
description.auto: Prune data unless pruning was disable previously for that DB.

pruning_history.name: Pruning History
pruning_history.description: Will keep up to {} old state entries.

pruning_memory.name: Pruning Memory
pruning_memory.description: Will keep up to {} MB old state entries.

fast_and_loose.name: Fast And Loose
fast_and_loose.description: Significant speed up but unclean exit is unrecoverable (disables DB WAL).

cache_size.name: Total Cache Size
cache_size.description: If defined will never use more then {}MB for all caches. (Overrides other cache settings).

cache_size_db.name: Database Cache
cache_size_db.description: Will keep up to {}MB data in Database cache.

cache_size_blocks.name: Blockchain Cache
cache_size_blocks.description: Will keep up to {}MB data in Blockchain cache.

cache_size_queue.name: Import Queue Cache
cache_size_queue.description: Will keep up to {}MB of blocks in block import queue.

cache_size_state.name: State Cache
cache_size_state.description: Will keep up to {}MB data in State cache.

description.auto: Detect if Fat DB was enabled previously.

scale_verifiers.name: Autoscale Verifiers Threads
scale_verifiers.description: Number of threads will vary depending on the workload. Not guaranteed to be faster.

footprint.description: Tune Parity CPU, Memory and Disk usage.

jit.name: Enable JIT
jit.description: Enables Just In Time compiler. Super-fast for CPU-intensive contracts.

ntp_servers.name: Ntp servers
ntp_servers.description: Comma separated list of NTP servers to provide current time (host:port). Used to verify node health. Parity uses pool.ntp.org NTP servers; consider joining the pool: http://www.pool.ntp.org/join.html

ports_shift.name: Ports shift
ports_shift.description: Add SHIFT to all port numbers Parity is listening on. Includes network port and all servers (RPC, WebSockets, UI, IPFS, SecretStore).

unsafe_expose.name: Unsafe expose
unsafe_expose.description: All servers will listen on external interfaces and will be remotely accessible. It's equivalent with setting the following: --{{ws,jsonrpc,ui,ipfs,secret_store,stratum}}-interface=all --*-hosts=all    This option is UNSAFE and should be used with great care!

interface.name: Interface
interface.description: Stratum Server will listen for connections on IP {}.

port.name: Port
port.description: Stratum Server will be running on port {}.

secret.name: Secret
secret.description: Secret for authorizing Stratum server for peers.

stratum.description: Stratum Server for miner push notifications.

pool_size.name: Pool size
pool_size.description: Target size of the whisper message pool in megabytes.
